page.title: 08Leighfields Farming Changes
page.content: Prior to the 1938-45 war Leighfield was primarily a grazing area with 119 enclosures. The fields were adequately supplied with water from springs and the grass keep was in many cases let out. The Ministry of Agriculture ploughed the land for the war effort and the area became arable which it has since remained. A few hedgerows were removed in the mid 1950's but many more have been removed since 1970 so that the area now comprises only 53 enclosures. The character of the area has therefore changed dramatically in recent years and local opinion is that as the area was unique in Leicestershire it was a pity that part of it at least wasn't preserved unaltered.
